job_title: Adjunct Faculty in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Friendly staff and faculty members. Fellow peer members are welcoming, and the work atmosphere is very productive

job_title: Administrative in Fort Myers, FL

job_title: Adjunct Professor in Fort Myers, FL

review_title: The more things change, the more they stay the same.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Passion for students, employee education and professional development.  Great work-life balance and benefits. Many opportunities for advancement if you start at the bottom but not a lot of opportunities at the management level.  Great place to work if you can isolate yourself from the politics of the "district" office.
cons: The politics prevent progress.  Some departments have formed 'cliques' and if you are part of the clique, you can get away with anything.  If you are not part of the clique, you will get no cooperation.  Many were optimistic that changes would be good but this has not proven to be the case and morale is very low. Poor leadership has resulted in high turnover and loss of many great employees.

job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Myers, FL
pros: The employees really care about the students and other employees. The faculty are great people.  Student services have undergone changes and are so much better than three years ago. You need to take care of everyone; not just the higher ups.  Staff and faculty are ignored. Unfortunately, the administration doesn't understand how to manage employees or a business. Management by fire and a spinning compass.
cons: The administration doesn't care.  They just get the job done good or bad.  Unfortunately, that mindset usually means bad.  Plus, they change so often I am not sure they have enough time to evaluate what they are doing.

job_title: Coordinator in Fort Myers, FL
pros: I really enjoyed my time at FSW. My staff of three was a great group of people and they worked really hard for the benefit of the college. They were extremely professional and supportive of each other and the individuals they served. Work-life balance was really good. I would periodically stay late, but it was not required of me. Some of the benefits include 2 weeks off at Christmas, a week for spring break, the usual federal holidays and my work days ended at 4:30 pm. Overall a good experience.
cons: I wish I had gotten to know more of the people on the campus and had the opportunity to interact with the VP for my area.

review_title: FSW is a progressive state college that has it all: strong academic programs, sports, arts, and other cultural events.
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Location, location, location. Working in the paradise of SWFL is amazing. No state taxes. Free employee health insurance. Great benefits. FSW is more organized than before. Offices such as HR, Advising, Financial Aid, and Bursar have some amazingly competent, talented, and thought leaders.
cons: The Peter Principle can be an issue here. Learn to have Crucial Conversations by analyzing how to make various leadership styles feel SAFE. Find your lane and stay in it at FSW. Must show and know your worth FAST. Then, stand your ground.

job_title: Assistant Course Designer in Fort Myers, FL
pros: The online department, where I worked, was excellent, but my ratings are an average of the college as a whole and the online department. What you get out of working at such a large institution is entirely dependent on which department you are working in as they tend to create their own microcosms that can vary significantly from department to department.
cons: FSW was having some administrative issues around the time I was leaving, but I believe they've fixed this now. You must have a degree if you want room for continued growth in your position.

job_title: Professor in Punta Gorda, FL
pros: The pay is good and you are not required to work summer.  Equipment in the classrooms are maintained and students have the ability to do a lot of hands on assignments.
cons: The administration does not support the student. Many of the students have been at the college too long without proper counseling and never graduate. Many of the students have no idea what they are studying or what classes they need to graduate. Many classes are never offered on some campuses but they are promised.

review_title: Name changed, ideologies of administration didn't...
job_title: Anonymous Employee in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Benefits are State based so as far as health insurances, the offerings are incredible if you're single because they are free. Time off is good too, but you pay into it. It isn't paid, and most employees outside of finance and payroll don't understand that.
cons: Organizational structure, incredibly political even for Higher Ed, biased administration (has favorites), Women are rarely respected, Black people are seen as subservient. Raises will never happen now that Walker is out, and good luck with Marketing. They have the world's worst designers on staff.

review_title: The best place I have ever worked!
job_title: Colleague in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Great atmosphere, especially when fall/spring semesters are in session. The campus is beautiful and well kept. Colleagues were so friendly and a pleasure to work with everyday. Communication among departments was seamless and the campus has implemented multiple safety precautions that made me feel comfortable to show up to work everyday. I cannot say enough great things about FSW!
cons: Room for growth, in my position specifically, was a little stagnant. Pay is decent for the job but the benefits are what make this place worth it. Campus is practically empty during summer, but that is inevitable - just wanted to make a note of it.

job_title: Student Tutor in Fort Myers, FL
pros: It is great experience if you are a student at this school. It will give you insight into the administration behind your academics as well as give you experience that you would otherwise not get through most other "normal" college jobs.
cons: The pay is on the lower side; however, for those who have roommates and do not live on their own, they may be able to manage with the low income.

job_title: Coordinator in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Dedicated staff who care about student success and degree completion.
cons: Hostile environment, fear factor and down mean spirited people.

job_title: Office Assistant in Naples, FL
pros:
Very good benefits, ample time off -college closed 2 weeks for Christmas and another week for spring break-You almost have earned paid time off. 
Work day is 8:30am-4:30 M-F
Office are nice
Staff is friendly
cons:
Not much opportunity for advancement
Small or no raises
Pay is low unless you an Administrator. 
No company loyalty

job_title: Staff Assistant in Fort Myers, FL
pros: Free tuition, some employee benefits.
cons: Everything. The departments aren't consistent. HR always needs people, the hiring process takes forever (because of lack of HR people). Want to create a new system for your department/program? Nope, has to be approved by a million departments and chances are, it won't be approved. One of the not so great companies I have worked for.

review_title: Currently a lot of on-campus growth and departmental restructuring.
job_title: Anonymous in Fort Myers, FL
pros: The students are ambitious and diverse, and the college is growing. The rebranding has proven to increase student involvement and excitement.
cons: Faculty is consistently given preferential treatment over staff members who feel under-appreciated. Very few events exist specifically for staff members.

review_title: Easy, low-key job. Good pay for very little work
job_title: Tutor in Fort Myers, FL
pros: It's very easy to become a tutor, and you often get paid your hourly rate for sitting around doing nothing.
cons: Sometimes you might get stumped, but the students are pretty understanding as long as you try to work through it.

job_title: Professor in Fort Myers, FL
pros: The school has one of the best campuses in the country: lush tropical green everywhere. The people are also very nice and helpful - they make a good team.
cons: No gym on the Lee campus (supposedly it is being built now).

job_title: Clinical Associate in Port Charlotte, FL
pros: Lots of energy on campus, great colleagues.

On-line systems somewhat difficult to navigate, Unable to respond to students e mail without going out to canvas.
Navigation through assignments not very intuitive.

review_title: Helped with everyday situation that occurred among the library
